column4: hello, i'm trying to install network manager for gnome. I don't have an internet connection yet and it does not appear to be on the ubuntu cd-rom.
How do I install it in another way?
depends on what you want to do with it james_xxx
it will work fine though
from the menu, System ->  administration -> networking that should be there
Why should it be there?
cos that is how it is in ubuntu this being the ubuntu help channel
unless there is special info you are keeping from me ;-)
My network card is detected and work fine, problem is that ubuntu doesn't seem to support wpa native. I need network manager for that, but I have no idea how to install it.
Synaptic install?
menu System Administration Synaptic Package Manager
Ah, problem is that it doesn't seem to be on the cd and I don't have internet access. If you are sure about it should be there though, I will go and check. Have to reboot and start Ubuntu :)
it is in main and so should be there
Sorry, it's not in the list - for me. Is it for you?
yes, which is why I said that
Strange...
I used the search and looked for network manager, it only found something for pcmcia cards
well i got it from main - can you see  wpasupplicant - Client support for WPA and WPA2 (IEEE 802.11i)
Ah I thought it was just called network manager, let me have a look (rebooting again)
thanks!
network-manager-gnome
There is no network-manager-gnome in the list.
go to packages.ubuntu.com and get the real one
